channel.title: RS classfiles are sriosly fkced..?
channel.description:
I'm having (more) trouble with this bytecode lib I'm making. This time it actually loads classes, just not classes from the RS client. It differs between obfuscated versions and different clinet versions, but I'm just having trouble loading the fields/methods. I have a bad feeling that I'm missing something big :(
So, if you could help I'd appreciate it lots.
http://id3y.com/shit/JABL.rar

item.title: RS classfiles are sriosly fkced..?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Ahh, thanks man!

O FHK IT WORKS!

Read full topic

item.title: RS classfiles are sriosly fkced..?
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

Yeah, but the size of the ArrayList isn’t changing. Try adding an extra CONSTANT_Null for each long/double that’s entered into the constant pool.

Read full topic

item.title: RS classfiles are sriosly fkced..?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Popcorn:

case 5: constant = new CONSTANT_Long(in.readLong()); i++; break; case 6: constant = new CONSTANT_Double(in.readDouble()); i++; break;

Tags 5 and 6 are long and double, and I’m increasing the constant pool index each time I get one of those. Right?

Read full topic

item.title: RS classfiles are sriosly fkced..?
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

The problem is that you’re only counting longs as one constant pool slot, when they actually take two.

Read full topic
